study_identification.title: Brain-Charting Autism and Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder Reveals Distinct and Overlapping Neurobiology

clarity_of_research_objectives.reason: The paper clearly states its aims to use population (normative) modeling to characterize cortical anatomy associated with autism and ADHD, examine effects of sex and age, investigate relationships with autistic/ADHD traits, and explore co-occurrence.
clarity_of_research_objectives.supporting_text: METHODS: Here, we used population modeling and a large, multisite neuroimaging dataset ... We also examined sex and age differences and relationship with autistic traits and explored the co-occurrence of autism and ADHD. ... Population modeling ... provides a unified framework for studying age-specific and sex-specific divergences in brain development.

clear_definition_of_target_population.reason: Diagnostic groups (autism, ADHD, TD controls), sex, and age ranges are clearly described. However, uniform diagnostic criteria (e.g., DSM/ICD) are not specified across datasets in this manuscript.
clear_definition_of_target_population.supporting_text: T1-weighted scans were combined from 49 sites across 7 datasets ... final dataset after quality control (QC) included 4255 individuals ... ages 2–64 years ... Individuals with MRI data and a primary diagnosis of autism or ADHD or no diagnosis were included. ... For details of each dataset, demographics before and after QC, and group differences, see Supplemental Methods Section 1.

clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_crite.reason: QC-based exclusion is described with explicit FSQC threshold and Euler covariate. Sample attrition before/after QC is tabulated. Beyond QC-related criteria, uniform inclusion/exclusion standards across studies are not fully specified.
clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_crite.supporting_text: All scans underwent manual QC ... FSQC tool ... A cutoff of 2.5 was used for FSQC. ... Sample demographics and N before and after quality control (QC).

validity_of_normative_modeling_outcome_m.reason: Outcome measures are well-defined: global and regional cortical metrics; centile scores derived from large reference GAMLSS models (n>75,000), accounting for age, sex, and site/scanner. Out-of-sample centile estimation is described.
validity_of_normative_modeling_outcome_m.supporting_text: Our previous work generated reference models using GAMLSS ... sample of 75,241 TD individuals ... accounting for effects of age, sex, and site/scanner. Out-of-sample centile scores ... generated using Brent's maximum likelihood estimation ... Centile scores quantify variation in brain development and range from 0 to 1.

handling_of_confounding_variables.reason: Age and Euler number are included as covariates; site differences are addressed using ComBat with covariates (age, sex, diagnosis); sensitivity analyses control for global brain measures; spin permutation used to account for spatial autocorrelation in map comparisons.
handling_of_confounding_variables.supporting_text: ComBat was applied ... with covariates of age, sex, and diagnosis ... All analyses included Euler number as a covariate, as well as age ... Multiple comparisons controlled by FDR ... Sensitivity analysis: controlling for GMV, total SA and mean CT ... spin permutation testing.

clarity_of_data_sources.reason: Datasets are explicitly named (ABIDE, POND, HBN, ADHD200, Female ASD (NDAR), UK MRC-AIMS, UCSD Biomarkers). Supplement provides site-level and scanner details and links.
clarity_of_data_sources.supporting_text: T1-weighted scans were combined from 49 sites across 7 datasets, including ABIDE, POND, HBN, ADHD200, Female ASD (NDAR), UK MRC-AIMS, and UCSD Biomarkers ... For details of each dataset ... see Supplemental Methods Section 1.

description_of_image_acquisition_protoco.reason: Supplement details scanner manufacturers, field strengths, head coils, and sequence types for each dataset/site (e.g., Siemens TrioTim/Prisma, GE Signa HDxt; MPRAGE).
description_of_image_acquisition_protoco.supporting_text: HBN ... Siemens 3T TrioTim ... Siemens 3T Prisma ... MPRAGE sequence. UCSD ... GE Signa HDxt 1.5T ... infants sleeping. POND ... 3T Siemens Trio TIM ... upgrade to Siemens Prisma.

details_of_data_preprocessing.reason: Preprocessing is described: FreeSurfer v6.0.1; DK atlas parcellation; hemisphere averaging; manual QC with FSQC (cutoff 2.5); Euler number included as covariate.
details_of_data_preprocessing.supporting_text: T1 images ... processed using FreeSurfer, version 6.0.1 ... Desikan-Killiany atlas ... measures were averaged across hemispheres ... All scans underwent manual QC ... FSQC ... cutoff of 2.5 ... included Euler number as a covariate.

clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.reason: No train/validation/test split was used for this study dataset; out-of-sample centile scores were computed using pre-trained reference models.
clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.supporting_text: Out-of-sample centile scores for our study sample were generated based on these reference models using Brent's maximum likelihood estimation.

details_of_normative_modeling_approach.reason: Normative modeling via GAMLSS is described, including reference model size, covariates (age, sex, site/scanner), and out-of-sample centile estimation with Brent's MLE. ComBat harmonization precedes centile estimation due to small site Ns.
details_of_normative_modeling_approach.supporting_text: GAMLSS reference models ... 75,241 TD ... accounting for age, sex, site/scanner ... Out-of-sample centile scores ... using Brent's maximum likelihood estimation ... ComBat ... with covariates of age, sex, and diagnosis ... used as inputs to out-of-sample MLE.

details_of_training_algorithm.reason: No model training was performed on this study dataset; centiles are derived from previously trained reference models.
details_of_training_algorithm.supporting_text: Out-of-sample estimates ... generated based on these reference models ...

model_performance_evaluation_metrics.reason: The study does not train or evaluate model performance on this dataset; instead it analyzes group differences using centile scores.
model_performance_evaluation_metrics.supporting_text: Multiple linear regressions were used to examine diagnostic group differences in centile scores ... Cohen's d effect sizes ... FDR correction.

implementation_of_internal_validation.reason: No internal validation of trained models is applicable because no model training occurred on the study dataset.
implementation_of_internal_validation.supporting_text: Out-of-sample centiles from pre-existing reference models were used; no training/validation split.

external_data_validation.reason: No external validation of a model trained in this work is applicable; centiles originate from previously validated reference models.
external_data_validation.supporting_text: GAMLSS reference models were previously developed and validated; this study applies them out-of-sample.

description_of_dataset_characteristics.reason: Sample sizes, demographics, attrition (pre/post QC), and site-level breakdowns are provided in Supplementary Tables S1.2.1–S1.2.5.
description_of_dataset_characteristics.supporting_text: Before quality control ... 4736 participants ... Table S1.2.1: Participant demographics by study (before QC) ... Table S1.2.2: Participant demographics by study (post QC) ... Participant numbers by site (before/after QC) ... Characteristics and significant differences between diagnostic groups.

performance_metrics_and_statistical_unce.reason: The study reports effect sizes (Cohen's d), p-values, and FDR correction for multiple comparisons. Confidence intervals for group effects are not reported in the main text; uncertainty for reference growth curves is described in prior work.
performance_metrics_and_statistical_unce.supporting_text: Multiple comparisons were controlled for using the false discovery rate correction ... Cohen's d effect sizes were calculated ...

consideration_for_reproducibility.reason: Software version (FreeSurfer v6.0.1) and processing/QC methods are specified. Several datasets and the BrainCharts reference models are openly available. However, this paper does not provide a dedicated code repository or full pipeline scripts.
consideration_for_reproducibility.supporting_text: processed using FreeSurfer, version 6.0.1 ... The ABIDE dataset ... publicly available ... ADHD200 ... publicly available ... the original openly available BrainCharts models ...

interpretation_specific_to_normative_mod.reason: The manuscript uses individual-level centile deviations to compare groups, examines overlap of extreme centiles, and discusses normative modeling as a framework for individualized interpretation and potential clinical translation.
interpretation_specific_to_normative_mod.supporting_text: Population modeling ... provides a potential route toward clinical and translational applications ... We ... examined the amount of regional overlap in participants ... with the greatest divergences from the average centile score ...

additional_comments.additional_comments: This study applies pre-existing GAMLSS-based BrainCharts models to derive out-of-sample centile scores; therefore, items related to model training, partitioning, and validation are not applicable. Site effects are addressed both via GAMLSS covariates in the reference and by ComBat harmonization prior to centile estimation in this dataset.
